definition: to wear a hat/(fig.) to stigmatize/to be branded as
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: With a good head of hair you don't need a hat.
sentences.chinese: 你有一頭濃髮，不必戴帽子了。

sentences.english: A man with a cap was on a ladder, cleaning the wall.
sentences.chinese: 一個戴帽子的人站在梯子上刷牆。

sentences.english: I asked Ortega why he has been wearing a hat for so long.
sentences.chinese: 我問歐特加，爲什麼他戴帽子戴了那麼長時間。

sentences.english: You should have seen her smile when she saw me wearing a hat.
sentences.chinese: 你得看看她瞧見我戴帽子時的開心笑臉。

sentences.english: His head was bare. He appeared to have grown thin and pale.
sentences.chinese: 他頭上沒戴帽子，臉色顯得蒼白，並且瘦了。

sentences.english: Wearing a fitted hat on your commute to work with your business suit or with just pants and a dress shirt isn’t a good look.
sentences.chinese: 在地鐵上戴帽子配西服套裝或者襯衣西褲並不好看。

sentences.english: I have a thing about wearing hats, even when it's cold.
sentences.chinese: 我很討厭戴帽子，甚至天氣冷也不戴。

sentences.english: He never pushed the hat to one side of his head, but wore it straight.
sentences.chinese: 他從來不歪戴帽子，而是整整齊齊地戴着。

sentences.english: Everyone likes to wear hats at Greenhill.
sentences.chinese: 在格林希爾我們都喜歡戴帽子。

sentences.english: If he wears hats, the rash may spread across his scalp or forehead.
sentences.chinese: 如果有戴帽子，痱子也可能出現在前額的頭皮上。

sentences.english: Wear a hat and a long-sleeved shirt for added protection.
sentences.chinese: 戴帽子並穿長袖衣服來增強防護。

sentences.english: Here in the Gascogne region, it’s whenyou don’t wear a beret that you’re out of fashion.
sentences.chinese: 在加斯格區這裏，不戴帽子的時候，你才落伍呢。

sentences.english: You can wear a hat any old time, with any outfit, of any color.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在任何時間戴帽子，與任何顏色的外衣相配。

definition: to shave the whole head clean/crushing defeat
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to wash one's hair/to have a shampoo
to stay warm/to protect against the cold
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation
